column2: alyk03, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: So, I've been taking Chantix for almost 2 weeks, and I've smoked a cigarette or two, but they taste disgusting. I'm happy that I'm not smoking and everything, but I've had a CONSTANT headache for almost the entire 2 weeks, so I'm going to the dr. tomorrow to see if I can't do something about them. The other symptom that has really affected me is the nausea / gas and bloating. I would definately recommend that anyone with IBS, Chrones, or any other stomach related problems try something else first because it has really done a number on my stomach. My best suggestion, eat first.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug is truly amazing! I thought quitting would be the hardest thing I have ever done but it has been pretty effortless thanks to Chantix! There are some side effects deal with such a bad dreams, upset stomach and gas but it is all well worth it to be smoke free. I could not be happier...thank you Chantix!

column2: sandi, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had quit 2 different times on my own and went back to smoking but this time so far I havent had that desire, its been 9 months and counting. even with what the bad publicity news I have heard i would do this again, i feel so much better and have been told i look so much better.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am on week 2 of Chantix. Have not smoked in 5 whole days. This truly is a wonder drug. I feared quitting would be very hard but I feel I am doing so well!There are some side effects....headaches, feeling sleepy all the time and some weird dreams but nothing too bad. I am so happy with Chantix and am spreading the word to everyone I know.

column2: Jayne, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I have been a smoker for 32 years, I went on chantix to help me quit, I am very pleased with it I have not smoked for a little over a month th first week was hard. I have had no side effects from this drug and I feel it works very well.

column2: Master Shake, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The only problem I've had with this medication is naseua. Anyone that says it's not easy to use is delusional. It's like birth control but after the 3rd day you take it twice instead of once. I'm on day 4 and thinking of cigarettes makes me ill, so it's serving its purpose. I'd take a mild case of naseua anyday over cancer, emphazima, etc. So for those of you that want to quit but are having a hard time on your own, Chantix gives you the extra boost you need. I highly recommend it.

column2: lovgrandma, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was nauseus,had terrible headaches,and was irratable the whole time,I also developed a skin rash and at times I thought my heart would beat out of my chest.

column2: edsmith23@msn.com, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I had recurring nightmares that picked up from the place last left from the night before.  It was an awful experience and I dumped the rest of my prescription down the toilet.  The good news is that I have been tobacco-free for 2 weeks shy of a year, but the only credit I give Chantix is that it enabled me to get myself launched and for my  willpower to take over from there.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been smoke free for 4 weeks now. I had quit cold turkey 1 week before taking the drug.  I think the drug is very effective, it also helps if you are really serious about quiting.  My side effects are being tired all the time and having a short fuse.  I would strongly recomend this to anyone.

column2: rt228, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After 40 years of smoking 2 packs per day i started on Chantix after 8 days i was smoke free.. took the pills for 45 days more ..i had no real problems with it...it was the easy thing i ever done!! thanks for Chantix i'm still smoke free and loving it!!!

column2: Bingomambo5, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Smoked 2 packs a day and started taking Chantix.  Happy to say i'm smoke free.  It really is a miracle pill.  Watch out Marlboro, you may be going out of business.  Thanks Chantix!!!!  Next we need a pill that's as good as Chantix to lose weight. :)

column2: bashfuldm6, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been a smoker for thirty-five yaers,I was 15 years old when I started to smoke.Well now I am 45 years old and I am tired of smoking telling me how to run my life.So I decided to chantix,well it worked from day one. I took it for three month (I had to reduce the dose because it was to strong.The only side effect I had was that I was verbaly abuses to my husband.Which I hated and I really don't know how he put up with me for so long.After I stop taking chantix the urges to smoke came back,so I tried a cigarett and it was gross and gave me headaches. I am still having those urges I went back on chantix taking 1mg a day.I believe this drug really works along with WILL POWER.

column2: kgjartist, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug is WONDERFUL! I have smoked for 35 yrs 1+pk a day.  The first week they did't even taste good.  I am in my 3rd week, and have had about 5 cigs in the last two weeks.  Just tossed 1/2 pack in the garbage.  I'm done.  No real cravings for nicotine.. just the emotional need to smoke, but that is leaving me too.  Side effects?  Yes, Gas, bloating, constipation, but I can live with that.  Just remember to take the pill with food and water as it is a little hard on your stomach.  I have been using lemon/honey sugar free cough drops as a substitute for smoking. They tend to open up you sinuses and lungs which is a good substitute for the deep inhale you do with smoking. It is important to eat foods that do not add to the gas problem, and watch what you eat.  Three weeks now, and I have not gained a pound.  Weight gain is a big issue with me, so I'm very happy with this product.  Good luck to all of you!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After taking Chantix about 3 months I was still smoking so I quit taking it. Since then I had moderate to extreme anxiety/panic for 3 months after stopping the drug. In addition, I can't sleep. I dream all night and get up exhausted. That started the second week on Chantix. I have been off it for 5 months and still dream all night long. I don't know how to make it stop. I would not recommend taking this drug. You may end up with more problems than you started with.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Chantix has helped control cravings and has made me cut way back even after only one week of treatment. I have to say though it does make you feel kinda strange at times, and is hard to fall asleep and stay a sleep. Other than the few issues ive mentioned, i would reccomend Chantix to stop smoking. It really does help.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I am only on week 5 and smoking 1-2 cigarettes a day, but my cravings are surely less with chantix than any other time I have tried to quit.

column2: cmac, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At first I thougth it was working great, and then the nightmares began.  I was so stressed from not getting enough sleep that I started smoking again.  I tried to take it earlier in the day to see if it would help ease the night terrors, but nothing seemed to help.

column2: incaseukerr, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this medication is the BOMB, dreams ehh, nausea ehh, mouth sores ehh, compared to 23 years of smoking I will take the side effects graciously, without complaint.

column2: Tabu2, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this for about 10 weeks.  My insurance doesn't cover the cost so I cut the dose in half and felt more urge to smoke.  I have been out for a few days and the urge is just as strong as it was before Chantix.  It works very well if you want to quit.  Nausea if not taken with food and gas/bloating are a pain.  I found when taking 2 doses a day that if I took the 2nd dose at suppertime, the dreams were cut WAY back.  I have to pick up my refill tonight and am glad that I'm getting more.

column2: Lindalu, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: After 40 years of smoking, I finally decided the time to quit HAD ARRIVED.  Spent a month preparing myself for this new way of life -- only smoking 1/2 a cigarette, also using water as a substitute.  Had decided not to tell my family or any friends that I was prepping myself for a new way of life.  You know how it is, if one fails at something like this, family and friends never let one forget about the failure.  Saw my doctor, got my prescription and never have smoked again.  While it's only been 2.5 months, I'm considering myself a non-smoker.  Physically I feel great and feel that I'm no longer held hostage by nicotine.  Had a few of the side effects but, in the long run, they haven't been a problem.  For anyone really wanting to quit, Chantix may be the answer.  I'm still amazed that it's worked for me.  If you're ready to quit, I wish you luck -- you CAN do it!

column2: BillC8705, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this medication last year but only for a brief amount of time. While I was taking it, I was able to quit smoking. Then figured I didn't need the Chantix anymore so I stopped the use of it. I started again April 10th of this year and was smoke free once again within the first 7 days. I still get some urges to light up but not like I must. The side effects are strange. First off (my favorite) the dreams are irregular, and the sleep...forget about it. Not refreshing. I'm bloated and sometimes can't make a b.m.. My mood has changed slightly as I am more irritable with much shorter patience. If you can look past that, its amazing how it works. I'm just hoping there is no dependency. Hope this helps ya.

column2: Non-Smoking Cricket, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Not a New Year's resolution, but 01/05/08, began taking medication.  Smoked at least a pack a day.  Started medication, & prior to quit date, was smoking 1/2 a cigarette a day, to finish out what was at home.  When cigarettes ran out, never went and bought more.  Husband quit too, but cold turkey.  I had some of the sleep, vivid dreams, but about 1 1/2 months in, I simply cut dosage back to one pill a day, in the morning.  Dreams lessened.  Now take 1/2 pill every other day.  Still no desire & smoke free.  I think you really have to want to quit & stop looking for reasons you can't.  Husband smoke free going on 4 months, & I'm past three months, into 4th.  I've been around people who smoke, it doesn't cause me to want one, mostly the smell bothers me, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.  To all trying to quit this habit, hang in there, keep at it, I wish you much success & reach for your goals.

column2: Sandy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is my 7th. day, I went to a boot camp and after half an hour for the first time I felt dizzi, I had on my left eye like a black cloud, I have been depressed, and very very sad.

column2: missbhven1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Chantix is a life saver. I started taking it Feb.1st and stopped smoking Feb.14th. Easiest way to stop smoking. Well worth the minor side effects, weird dreams and metallic taste and gas.Even though it can be expensive its worth it.But still cheaper than buying cigarettes. If you really want to stop smoking no matter how long you have smoked, this stuff works!!! The support you get from the get quit program helps alot to. Chantix has saved my life. I have been happily smoke free for 68 days. I never want to be a smoker again.

column2: Spunky, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Gained some weight.  May be due to quiting smoking.

column2: Mark, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I smoked a pack a day plus for 35 years. Always had an excuse for not quiting. I tried other methods, patch, Zyban, hypnosis, nagging wife. NOTHING worked. Then someone (see nagging wife) suggested Chantix. I had my last cigarette on March 27th 2007. My wife's not nagging anymore and I'm not hacking and coughing anymore. I guess I suffered some of the side effects that others describe on here. But, they were nothing to whine about. I consider my self a NONsmoker now. Thank you Chantix. And oh yea, Thank you too naging wife.

column2: skier, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I smoked for 40 years and tried to quit unsuccessfully several times.  This drug is the ONLY thing that has every truly helped in the battle to quit.  By the end of the first week I had no desire to smoke and haven't had more than 2 or 3 urges in the 4 1/2 months since.  Even those were easy to ignore as by the time I stopped smoking at the end of the first week cigarettes tasted just awful.  Therefore my last memory is not a good one.  I feel I've finally done it!

column2: whitepolar03tm@hotmail.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: what are side offects

column2: redrose183, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: difficulty breathing and extreme nausea and upset stomach. Still have cigarette craving but I feel that the medication made the first day possible(not nearly as hard as I though it would be) and it did help set a date for  me to quit. If symptoms continue-i will ask my doctor if i can stop taking the medication.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: stomach pain and sever bloatin, so bad i had to quit the meds also my breathing and shortness of breath became worse i think.

column2: Honeybee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I smoked cigars and have tried everything to quite. This medication really works well by the seventh day I had quite smoking without even trying. It does upset my stomach for about an hour after taking it and I have had some bad dreams, but nothing I cannot live with. In the end, it will have been worth it after all what is a little upset stomach and a few bad dreams compared to a lifetime of being tobacco free?

column2: seeker, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medicine work pretty good for me i was surprised. I did experience some nausea for about the first hour after taking. I just got up and did some chores. It helped. Had some cool bizarre dreams nothing scary. If this drug doesn't work for me then i probably dont really want to quit somking bad enough.

column2: mikeyu72, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I stopped smoking after the first week, no cravings what so ever, when I upped my doage I started have severe panic attacks, Doc gave me Xanaax which only midly helps, I'm jittery all the time and can't sit still for more than a minute. Talked to Doc again, this time it's chest pain on top of the other stuff, headaches, blurry vision Doc says "don't take any more chantix, see what happens" It's been four days and still no change in side effects. Gonna go back to the Doc and see what happens.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I felt strange after taking for 4 weeks.

column2: soapsfan, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The only thing I did not like about this medication was that I was getting headaches every day since the day I started it.

column2: gwen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Chantix in January08.  My last cigarette was January 21,2008. I had 2 strange dreams and only mild upset stomach. I have been off the Chantix for over a week, still have no cravings.  I think the benefits far outway the side effects

column2: Smokeless in Life, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was a smoker for over 30 years, smoking one to two packs a day.  I have tried hypnotism, acupuncture, the patch, pills, lozenges, and cold turkey.  None of these worked.  My symptoms have been horrible.  You really have to take this medication with lots of food and water.  It burns my stomach.  I have an ulcer from smoking, so I have to take Prolosec everyday.  The nausea is terrible sometimes, but drink lots of water.  Also, I have had funny dreams, but not nightmares.  I have retained a lot of fluid in my body from this drug.  I have lots of gas, sometimes painful.  I went through a couple of weeks of feeling like I was starving, but now I am back to normal.  Also, remember when you take two pills a day, make sure you take both pills.  If you miss one, you will go back to smoking more.  After awhile of taking this drug, you feel like you are smoking air and don't get that fix you would without it.  I have quit now for two days and I'm going to continue to take it for another two weeks or until I have no more cravings.  The cravings are very weak now and that's enough for me to stop.  This is like a poison going through my body with each dose.  If you can take the side effects, please take this drug because it does work.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My mom took chantix and expressed to me that it was working well. My mom passed away 3 weeks after taking chantix. My mom had no immedite health problems. I ask people to take caution and wait for further review of the drug.

column2: Happy, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Chantix is a miracle drug! I was a smoker for 37 years at two packs a day since going to ultra lite cigarettes. Tried to quit once around '95 with the patch. It was not successful. Again, when Zyban came out but had side effects and quit using. When I tried quitting before I had all the typical withdrawal symtoms. Lack of concentration, very grouchy, really irritable, totally preoccupied with the pain I was going through, couldn't sleep - and when I did sleep - had wild, vivid nightmares. I had NONE of these symptoms with Chantix.Went totally smoke free Nov. 29, 2007. Didn't even have any cravings to smoke the whole time.  Only change was a lttle more dreaming.  When I went to bed, it was like going to the movies (could have put a bag of popcorn next to my pillow). They were just dreams, not nightmares like when trying to quit with the patch. And each night they were different. No reruns here!If you really want to quit smoking, and have had difficulty with other choices, try Chantix, it is absolutely amazing. You still need will power to stay smokefree and I imagine that's how it will be from now on out.

column2: molly, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is the best quit smoking drug I have tried.The first two weeks I did have a little nausia,but now I am on my 4th week and I feel great.I very pleased with this product,and with it I know that this time I will remain smoke free.THANKS TO CHANTIX!!!

column2: slim, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I smoked a pack a day for 33 years.  I quit on day 8 of treatment with Chantix.  I had no nicotine withdrawal, and it has been 9 days since I last smoked.  I feel much better alrady, and a confident that I have kicked the habit for good.  As for side effects, I have noticed that dreams are more vivid.  Also, I feel drowsy and require more sleep.  The product really has worked for me.

column2: Greg, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Chantix in late Dec '07. In January of '08 I only smoked 2 or 3 cigarettes. In the beginning of Feb, I had finished the medication and the cravings came back and I also suffered from appendicitis. It was so bad, I had gangrene and emergency surgery. Chantix did take away the cravings, but I believe it also caused my appendicitis. I noticed most the people writing reviews are middle aged women. Maybe Chantix only causes appendicitis in younger males like me.

column2: non smoker, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have smoked since I was 14 and have been a 2 pack a day smoker for the past 20 years.  I have made 2 visits to the emergency room this past year for breathing problems contributed to smoking.  I started this drug in October and have finally quit 10 February.  As for the side effects, I have been constipated for the 1st month.  I tried all kinds of fiber supplements to no avail.  What I discovered finally helped was pounding water.  Drink, drink, drink water when on Chantix.  It does help with the constipation.  I still get naeseated from the medication and have constant gas and bowel movements.  These side effects are minimum compared to gasping for air as I had done during my emergency room visits.  I have over a month of sobriety from cigarettes and can breath allot easier.  To me well worth the risk of side effects.  Everyone has to make the decision for them selves if they want to risk taking Chantix to stop smoking and put up with the side effects.  Don't blame the medication or the Pfizer for creating the drug.  Be responsible make a decision and stand by it.  Stop wining about the side effects.  They are published by Pfizer.  What it really comes down to is my desire to stop smoking.  I live with the side effects and celibrate my quiting every time I take a deep breath.  Thank you Pfizer

column2: jennifer, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this is my 9th day on the pill and im down to one cigrette a day ,been having gas and constipation but its worth it if its going to help me stop smoking all together,been smoking for 13years and looking forward to quitting!

column2: royceeb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Started Chantix 2-21-8 - stopped smoking 2-26-8, stopped Chantix 3-8-8. Terrible, frightening side effects: extreme weakness with dizziness; blurry vision like with a migrain but without the pain; runny and bloody nose; bleeding gums; ear and throat pain like getting an infection; ringing in ears; shortness of breath; trouble falling asleep and staying asleep; depression; sick days from work.  Other side effects that were not frightening: nausea, vivid dreams, constipation, water retention.

column2: Fax, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: Had terrible mood swings,Felt agresive and flew off the handle far too easily.I'm not a drinker so that claim by the drug company does NOT apply here. Shame on them for pushing this on the public as any sort of remedy. I stopped taking this after Three weeks and it took a week for me to feel like me old easy going self. Good Luck if your trying to quit smoking. This is NOT the best choice for many,HOWEVER it seems to be being PUSHED as a cure all for this addiction. I be waiting for the final results of this latest FDA report.

column2: cheermom1962, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I am a 3 pack a day smoker,  I have been on chantix two weeks,  each day I gradually cut down,  on the 11th day I went without and I've been three days now.  What a miracle drug, only a few crazy dreams that have kinda been entertaining.  I've had no stomach problems, I was alittle concerned over the depression I've seen that others have had, since I do have just alittle problem with depression, but if anything I've been in a silly mood.  It has made me feel just alittle fuzzy headed, like a medicine head feeling,  my cravings haven't been that bad.  I really should be the poster child for chantix.  So far it's been a miracle for me!!!

column2: gtlander44, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: has help to cut back on smoking. but have gained about 30 pounds so far.

column2: wishy/washy, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took chantix for three months.Quit smoking after the first week, and havn't smoked since.THANK YOU GOD!!  My problem is that I had horrible nightmares and about two weeks after I quit the drug,out of nowhere I had a TOTAL mental breakdown. Got emitted to the emergency room now I have to see a therapist,and a physciatrist for extreme depression,anxiety,and insomnia,because the nightmares are still occuring.  Part of me feels blessed to quit smoking after 2 packs a day for 15 years,but at this cost I don't know if it was worth taking the medicine. It's been 12 days since the breakdown and all the Doctors believe its because of the chantix messing up the chemicals in my brain. Has this happened to anyone else?  Will I return to my normal self?  I am now on Prozac for depression,Xanex for anxiety,and Rozerem for insomnia for they say at least 3 months til I get under control.  I am not the person I once was...Hope this helps someone.....

column2: luckylynn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: have had severe nausea from not drinking enough water.  I have had cravings for my cigarette, some where severe others were mental...however i relied on using some of the 12 step sayings and asked God to help me resist....  I am nicotine free 25 days now.

column2: Rehab Smoker, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I smoked about .5 to one pack at day for the past 8 years.  i tried to quit cold turkey serveral times with no luck.  chantix totally killed the cravings with minor side effects.  Minor stomach cramping that would last for about 30 mins.  no major psycho dreams either just very weird dreams.  just make sure you have plenty of suckers and gum handy to help with the physical habit.  it's great to be back in control of my life.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have smoked for over 20 years and nothing, I mean nothing would help when I tried to quit.  Not the patch, the gum, nothing until chantix.  Other times when I have tried to quit I was a maniac.  I was depressed, mean, could not sleep, and my family and friends did not want to be around me.  Until, I used chantix!  Yes there are a few bad side effects like being sick to my stomach for a few minutes and having some very vivid dreams.  But, as I already mentioned, I have tried every other way to quit and feel 100 times better taking this medication than with any of the other options out there.  NO DEPRESSION THIS TIME!! TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!

column2: JOE, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: HAS STOPED THE WAN'T TO SMOKE

column2: kj, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have finally quit smoking after two months of Chantix therapy...I have had some "extremely" bad gas, I don't know if it is due to this drug or something else.  There has been some comments about Chantix and people who have anxiety or depression disorders, and Chantix "may" make those disorders worse, however, I have been living with both of those disorders for over ten years and stable with prescription therapy (Paxil) for over a year now and Chantix has not caused me any problems with my anxiety or depression, just really really bad gas...

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The only side effect I really noticed was if I didn't eat before I took it, I'd get very dizzy and nauseated (this was solved quickly by eating!). Make sure you don't contribute your side effects to the pill rather than nicotine withdrawal! I quit smoking the day after I started taking it, stopped the medication completely last week and have not smoked for two months. It's a miracle and I advise it for ANYONE who smokes!

column2: Morgllin, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug has helped me quit, maybe drinking too.  But I've took it for only a month and hve to stop because of the pain it is causing im my stomach.  I also can't sleep well.  I still think it is worth it even tho i have had major discomforts!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been taking this medication for 3 days and so far so good. I have not smoked all day and it feels great. We will see how things go as I continue the treatment.

column2: LizzieBee57, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had smoked one pack a day for 30+ years and tried to quit several times but failed.  This time I used Chantix and it was the easiest thing I have ever done. By the beginning of the second week, I was down to one, and had totally quit by the beginning of the third week. It was as though I had never even been a smoker at all.   I also did not experience the nausea, headaches or other side effects that I was warned about. Thank God for Chantix!  I am smoke-free and feeling so much better.   My husband and I began Chantix together and he was a 2 pack a day smoker.  He has also had success with the drug and is beginning his second week without a cigarette. It feels so good to be free of this very expensive habit!  I recommend this to everyone who is serious about quitting!

column2: P56DIZ, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I'LL CALL IT THE MIRACLE DRUG. SMOKED FOR 35 STRAIGHT YEARS AND STARTED CHANTIX 6/16/07. DIDN'T SET A DATE TO QUIT BUT QUIT 3 WEEKS LATER AND HAVEN'T HAD A CIGARETTE SINCE. THE DESIRE FOR A CIG MIGHT RETURN FOR 3-5 SECONDS BUT MY CONSCIOUS SAYS NO WAY JOSE. NOT AN OPTION. HAVE TRIED TO QUIT PERMANENTLY 100'S OF TIMES AND THIS TIME I REALLY DID IT. THANKS CHANTIX. I INVESTED IN PFIZER JUST BECAUSE OF CHANTIX. TA-TAAA AND GOOD LUCK. YOU CAN DO IT TOO.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: while it made it relativly easy to stop smoking being on chantix for 3 month made me feel very fatigued and also extremely depressed

column2: footballmom89, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I smoked for 25 years and quit this year using Chantix.  It took me until week 9 to quit completely, but I did!  I just quit taking the prescription about two weeks ago and so far so good!  I think people have to keep in mind that some of these panicky and depressed feelings they are having may be from the withdrawal of not having nicotine.  It seems that everyone is quick to blame the drug, but if you visited a drug rehabilitation hospital, I bet you would find a lot of people with the same symptoms from drug withdrawal.  Your body is going through a lot when you quit smoking.  My thyroid medication even had to be adjusted!  If you really want to quit, you can....if you want to find an excuse not to, there's a million of them.

column2: Becky, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The first 7 days were the easiest!  If I smoked I didn't like it.  I have been on Chantix for almost 3 weeks now.  I am experienceing a great amount of depression and anxiety that I have not experienced during other quit attempts.  I am beginning an anti-depressant.  I am not quitting Chantix though.  ALL the hard emotion for 3 weeks, I do not want to quit again.  Will continue on this time.  I did quit on day 8 and never want to start over!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am on day 7 of taking the pills. On day one I began to lose the pleasure of smoking. I must say it was upsetting. Still smoking but only about 1/2 as much. My only complaint is my tongue always feels very dry and when I do smoke it feels like its burnt. I do have more vivid/very strange dreams but nothing too bad.  I will also say that I have been a nervous/anxious person ALL my life (never been medicated for it though) and have no adverse reactions to this drug. I am completely confident that within the next week or sooner I will be smoke free. I agree with another response here that stated that its not for everyone and we all have to remember we have used smoking to relieve alot of stressors etc in our life and by removing that or even the thought of that can be very upsetting to anyone. I know that I am honestly depressed (in a way) that I am not enjoying smoking anymore. But I know that I will get over this and will be MUCH BETTER OFF in the long run.  Good luck to everyone!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: People with anxiety or depression issues SHOULD NOT take this drug! Before taking this drug, both issues had not botherd me in years.  Within two days, I was extremely agitated and unable to control my anger.  Within the first week, my anxiety was throught the roof.  I took it for three weeks and then quit because of the side effects.  That was in November, it is now February and I am still not the same as I was before.  I have been working with my dr, but I am still having problems.  I am afraid I will never get better.  Before taking it, I read reviews and took my chances.  Please dont make my mistake if you have these issues.  DONT TAKE CHANTIX.  Taking it was one of the worst decisions I have ever made!

column2: artie, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I smoked for over 20 years, and after taking this for 2 weeks--no more smoking!  works great!  small to no side affects, i recommend to any one trying to quit!

column2: deranger,  Male  (Patient)
column9: After needing a two month dose, I have been smoke free now since August, 2007(20 year smoker). Aside from a little weight gain, everything is so much better overall, but after 6 months off Chantix, I am now currently experiencing enhanced sensations related to panic attacks and heightened claustrophobia. It has gotten to the point where I cannot fly on airplanes, or sit in the back of a car or bus, etc without feeling an overwhelming panic sensation. No problems with these extreme feelings prior to using Chantix.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have nausea and vomiting and really weird dreams. It's ok though. I've been a smoker for over 25 yrs. It's going to take time to break this habit. From 1 1/2 ppd down to 1/2 ppd. I know....but I am very very satisfied w/the results so far. I find I am smoking out of habit and not urge - thanks to Chantix. I will continue treatment and be smoke free. I have to. I want to see ALL my children grow up. Chantix is a miracle.

column2: Quitter, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Today is my 7th day on the pill also my last set date for quitting smoking, I feel very confident in not smoking from today forward. I gave a pack of cigarettes to my annoying neighbor today (who always asks for a cigarette) that pack of cigarettes is one of the 7 packs I had purchased to prepare myself.. I noticed that i dont finish my cigarette nor my usual pack a day. Although the side effects might be a pain here and there, i honestly think it is worth it. Think of the money you'll save, and once this 12week program ends you wont be dealing with the side effects.

column2: cdlineberry, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Athyrio, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 100% effective, my wife will never smoke again, she passed away 12/12/07. Weird dreams, depression, suicidal thoughts, upset stomach, hallucinations. She was being treated for chronic back pain and had medication that could have created an overdose. She was found by my daughter in bed, after I sent her over to check because I couldn't get hold of her while I was out of town. She had been talking weird to her best friend and me the day before and we both got worried. I am still waiting for the results of the toxicology reports from the medical examiners office. Please be very aware of the risks.

column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: 7 months smoke free thanks to chantix!!!

column2: Jared, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started this medication 8 days ago. Today is my "Quit Day". I've done the activities they suggest, and while there are still cravings 8 days in, they're not too bad. Keep with it even if you cheat now and then...MAKE SURE TO EAT BEFORE TAKING THE PILLS OR YOU WILL GET SICK!!! I've never been the type to get side effects from anything but the nausea and vivid dreams are obviously there with this drug.  Also, my partner is taking Chantix with me and he is not experiencing many (if any) of the side effects.  So it does vary.  I take this with Aciphex for acid reflux, and I notice even when eating before it sort of bubbles up and makes my stomach sour.  So if you can, don't take any tums, acid reducers, etc (prescription or otherwise) except more than an hour before or after the Chantix...my Dr also said that would reduce it's effectiveness.  Good luck, and wish myself and my partner luck! Quit day: 2/8/2008

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have only had the dreams as a side effect, which I have enjoyed. I was down to one cigarette a day, and that out of habit. My husband did not take this and he was still smoking. My medication ran out and my cravings came right back. I was to the point that I could go 8 hours without even thinking about a cigarette, when I saw somebody else smoking it did not induce the urge. The medication is wonderful.

column2: Kimc4572, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Have been taking Chantix for 6 weeks, not smoking for 29 days and I was a smoker for 20 years.  Some side effects, nausea, interrupted sleep, agitated & jittery.  The nausea stopped after a couple weeks but still experiencing the others along with a little hair loss-more than usual.

column2: hanginginthere, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My husband and I wanted to quit smoking together and decided it was time to try Chantix. After taking the med for 2 weeks, I am smoke-free while he is down to 2 smokes a day. I am experiencing more difficulties with side efffects, i.e.,nausea, vomiting, dry mouth and metallic aftertaste, weird dreams and spaciness. I am also finding that my sense of smell is overcompensated, increasing the nausea.  Overall, I am thrilled to be smoke-free but am getting discouraged by the side-effects. I recommend to anyone considering trying Chantix to first find a support system, whether it be a partner,or family and friends for encouragement to continue this program. Being able to endure the side-affects remains to be unseen at this time since we are only beginning our third week.

column2: booter, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Please do not drink alcohol while taking this drug. I had a suicidal tendancy combining the two. I got severe rashes making it feel like my skin is crawling. Lots of side effects, but it works for quitting. I'm off now after 6 weeks, still not smoking but craving!

column2: Matt626, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Chantix for two weeks now and I have never felt better.  After the first week, I have completely stopped smoking starting on Day 8.  During the first week, I could actually feel the medication working.  Towards the end of the week, the pleasure I received from smoking slowly disappeared.  I plan to take the entire 12 week program, and perhaps an additional 12 weeks after that (as suggested by Pfizer and other Chantix boards).  I also would like to note that I am currently on medication for bi-polar depression and have not had any side-effects such as suicidal thoughts, panic attacks, etc.  The only side effect I experienced were a few vivid dreams for the first few days.  I have tried the nicotine patch, gum,  inhaler, and cold turkey prior to this, and never went more than a couple of weeks (including cheating).  This has been the most effective yet.  When I stopped smoking, I had to get over the physiological habits of smoking (smoking breaks at work, waiting for the bus, etc.).  I'm handling those well, but that's probably the toughest part.  The key to quitting effectively after finishing the Chantix program, is just like any other method of quitting, which is to never take another drag again...ever.  If you do, your brain goes right back into the nicotine craving, and you just blew a lot of money on the Chantix routine.  Hope this helps those who choose this option towards quitting smoking.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I was a 1/12 pack/day smoker.  Took medication and after the second day went to 5/day, after a week quit.  Side effect, headache, upset stomach, bloating, gas, and sexual side effect.

column2: RUNSWITHPKGS, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: SIDE EFFECTS: NAUSEA, CONSTIPATION, GAS, SLEEP PROBLEMS, ACHING NECK/SHOULDER JOINTS, JITTERY, ATTITUDE, WEIGHT GAIN, SORE BUTT MUSCLES,BLOATING. OFF THE DRUG SINCE SEPT. BUT STILL FEELING SOME OF THESE EFFECTS. AFTER ONLY 2 WEEKS ON THE DRUG STOPPED SMOKING COMPLETELY, AND HAVEN'T SINCE. SMOKED FOR OVER 30 YEARS.

column2: footballmom89, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I smoked a pack/day for 25 years.This rx really worked for me, although I couldn't stop on day 8.I continued taking it, and after week 2 was down to 1/2 a cigarette a day. Couldn't completely stop until week 9, but then it just happened!! I didn't need to cheat anymore!! My advice is that if you are like me and can't quit right away, keep taking the prescription and eventually it will work. I had a 10 pound weight gain and weird dreams, but it was all worth it. I do have depression and get panick attacks but have not noticed any increase since being on this prescription. I also discussed drug interactions with my dr. before I started this. None of my meds were a problem. Good luck to anyone starting!!  Don't give up if it takes you longer than other people!! Keep taking the prescription and try to cut down graduly and it WILL happen!!

column2: Kel-FL, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am in my 4th month of taking this drug. I quite smoking my 2nd week in to taking it. Glad I was able to quit. My side effects are headaches, loss of appetite,vomiting, acidic stomach, nightmares or no sleep, sinus infection. Went to the doctor regarding my sinus infection and she tried to treat it with antibiotics twice and now she put me on more antibiotics and allergy medicine. (I have never had allergies) Would I recommend this product? Yes, because some people have not experienced these side effects. I am glad to have quit smoking and I guess this made me sick enough to realize that if I go back to smoking, I will have to start these side effects all over again. Also, now that I can really smell the smoke on people, IT REALLY STINKS. But if you do try this product be careful of side effects and know how to recognize them.

column2: Emilyf47, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I felt the emotional side effects from this drug. I am on antidepressants and felt as if they were not working at all. I am aggitated, depressed, and an emotional rollercoaster. I have decided to quit taking this drug. I also have had sleep disruption and nauseau and gas.

column2: pam, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Did stop smoking,but interferd with mymedication.warfin effexor, welbutrin,xanax,pain meds. Thoughts of suicide. I would have attempted a overdose ,but was currently out of the meds that I could have overdosed on. My daughter figured out that it was the chantix causing the problems and flushed the pills. Ever since i've been fine,but I started smoking again.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: While taking chantix for 3 days I had 2 panic attacks, my doctor told me they were due to the chantix but wanted me to continue taking the meds. I stopped taking them the day of my first panic attack. While chantix may work for others I believe the side effects are not worth it.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was put on the Chantix and after starting the twice a day tablet starting having vision problems- even in a sitting position, everything around me would seem to be spinning. If I was walking when this happened, I would have to stop and remain still until the spinning stopped- a minute or two. I tried cutting back on the dosage and the problem still occurred. After stopping the Chantix it happened only once. That was almost 10 months ago and I haven't had the problem since. I firmly believe that it was caused by the Chantix and shudder to think what would have happened had I been driving when this occurred.

column2: verns, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have tried everything on this planet to stop I have not touched a cigarette in 9 months. This was effective and very beneficial  I passed this on to 10 people - they all have been successful

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: However, I smoked just one cigarette ater quitting for 4 months and now I think I need to start the twelve week program over  again.

column2: s153080, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I lost my desire for a cigarette about 2 hrs after the first dose. I have not had one since the first day of treatment. I have not experienced any side effects. This has been the most positive experience I have ever had trying to quit. I know now that I am an EX-smoker. Thanks Chantix.

column2: pamela, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: first week I was only smoking three cigerettes a day it has been a month and I am smoke free even when I went out and had a few drinks which I thought it might trigger me to smoke.  I did take a few drags off a cig but didn't like it. I only take one pill a day and that works for me.

column2: Pamela Carter, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I stopped smoking with the first script, however, it made me very unstable in mood.  I thought I was losing my mind but it was the pills.  I had terrible thoughts about life, my family, everything in general.  The only good thing about the experience was that I did quit smoking!

column2: supercat_63, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After about 3 weeks on Chantix I ended up in the hospital with chest pains and shortness of breath I thought I was having a heart attack.  Thank God all my tests came back negative for any heart problems, but the mood swings and the drowsiness were too much to deal with.  I stopped taking the Chantix and can proudly say I am almost at the 100 day mark of being smoke free.  Please check with your doctor before starting this medicine if you have high blood pressure as mine remained high the entire time I took Chantix.

column2: amarie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this is great thank you

column2: CPAVLICH , 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Yes - Chantix does what it claims to do!  I am pleased to say I have conquered the evil cigarette!  But,after reading all the other reviews, there are a few observations from my own experience that may be significant.  First, I think hormonal balance (or imbalance) is related to an individual's reaction to this drug.  (Personally, I wasn't sure if the emotional rollercoaster I found myself on was due to Chantix, the loss of my coping crutch, or menopause! All three combined made depression inevitable and hard to control.)  Second, as with any drug, it's NOT for everyone - but it's USE SHOULD BE MONITORED by every physician who prescribes it.  Take great care - this drug works IN THE BRAIN! but it has the potential to affect much of your life; work, relationships, physical and mental health - just to name a few.  Again, reaction to Chantix use seems to vary widely.

column2: smokefree2, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Chantix for 2 weeks now. Other than the metallic taste in my mouth and the horrible nightmares, Chantix has been wonderful. I haven't had a cigarette or the urge to smoke since I stopped on the 8th day.

column2: gail, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: my husband was on this med last year he started in august 06 and was still on this med when he had a very severe stroke he was 38 and there is no reasons for his stroke other than smoking and was told that he did not really smoke enough to have caused a stroke. he is left with being able to say three words and can walk short distances i really think it has something to do with this med. please know that you can quit with out this if you will rely on GOD. My husband may have not had this stroke if not for this med. has any one else had a stroke on this med.

column2: NoPuffin, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Cigarette free since 12/14/07. Chantix works great! The first seven days were very hard, like an emotional rollercoaster. Side effects I'm experiencing still: Bloated/Gas, Weight Gain(food tastes really good, now), irritable, mood swings, really wierd dreams(not nightmares), lack of energy. I guess the side effects aren't as bad as what could happen if I kept smoking. Overall, Chantix has worked, where other methods have not(like gum, patches, cold turkey)

column2: Mike, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor suggested this treatment to help me quit smoking. I was a regular smoker for over 20 years. My treatment was for 6 months instead of the normal 3 months. My doctor told me it increases your chance of success to @ 85%. This med is ver effective in reducing the cravings for nicotine. Within 8 days I stopped smoking and have not had a cigarette for over a year. There are some things you need to do to help you deal with the side effects. Please do not drink heavily with this medication as it can cause violent mood swings in some people. A few alcholholic drinks is Ok though. Always eat before you take the medication. It really made me sick to my stomach if I did not eat. Also eat a light snack before bed time to ease the occurance of bad dreams and headaches. I have had great success in beating the nicotine addiction I had for over 20 years. I would recommend this top anyone who REALLY wants to beat this drug.(nicotine)One of the other benefits to this treatment is no weight gain! Please beware if you try any tobacco product after you complete treatment your addiction will be even stronger than before treatment. DO NOT even try to smoke or chew or anything.

column2: joyce, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: makes me sick to my stomach not feel good depression worse but i did smoke less

column2: kidzrajoy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: While very effective at preventing cravings,especially noticable for me in the the second week,it upset my stomach greatly.

column2: jennlnathan, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on it for 16 days so far it is working less and less i am wanting a smoke. the second week where i quit was hard the first two days i was dizzy, shaking, and lightheaded. That turned out to be the nictoine withdrawl. I have been smoke free for 9 days. I have messed up once or twice but i could only have a couple puffs before i felt sick to my stomache. Day 9 is much easier this is a very good drug and I would recommend it to everybody. The side effects are not the bad though the dreams are very strange.It's a great product so far. I only worry what happens when I run out of the drug?

column2: Amanda96321, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I recently quit smoking on my own due to tonsillitis. It has been 2 days since my last smoke. My doc prescribed me the meds as well. I am a little leary about taking them. I have asthma. I take singular and advair each day. My doc says this is fine. But I cant help being nervous about it. I want to completely be rid of the urges and the smokes. It is a very hard addiction to get over. But I dont want to die of cancer or have to carry an O2 tank around either. Good luck to everyone! Try to drink alot of water to fight the urges, thats what I do.

column2: levendod, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The first day I started the medicine, I had terrible gas/bloating and very loose stools. Now that I've been on it a while those side effects have completely stopped... and within a week of starting Chantix my smoking has stopped also!  I have and would recommend this product to anyone wanting to stop smoking.

column2: bogey21963, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was a pack a day smoker for 32 yrs. tried everything,nothing worked. After three days of chantix,my cravings were totally gone. Have nodesire to light up either. This stuff is INCREDIBLE!!

column2: Chris, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Some of the side effects I am experiencing(Chantix or withdrawl)are constipation, trouble concentrating, acid reflux at night, some headaches, nausea if taken on an empty stomach, acne, sores in my mouth, and sometimes my breath smells like doo doo (seriously) especially when flossing. The side effects are easy to deal with so far.

column2: kathy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: have been taking chantix for 12 days and rarely wanted a ciggerette. the first 3 days had some weird dreams, the last 3 days been having a lot of indigestion and bloating. will talk to pharmacist tomorrow,other than that, this has worked for me. i have read a lot of bad reviews on other web sites that were frightening. i do know 2 people who quit using chantix with no side effects and has quit for a year already.. yahoooo... i did buy some smoke free ciggs(have no nicotene)but havent used them yet. if i do get the urge I will have 1 of them so I wont go back to real ones. that is what my husband did and hasnt smoked in 2 yrs.

column2: gracie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have been on chantix for 2 months but i am a little worried because i have had 2 tia (mini strokes)i am on coumidan this kind of worries me little i get nervous an shaky when i take the chantix i have smoked over a pack of cig.for 45 yrs i am down to about 3 cigarettes aday  any advice

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Good experience just tough to remember to take right after eating so my stomach would not get upset. Worked well for me.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Chantix worked for me. Side effects were mostly wierd dreams- like they weren't dreams at all. I took the full course- 90 days and have been cigarette free for 5 months and lovin it. If you are truly committed to quit smoking then any method will work- after a couple of days it is psychological not physica that you still want to smoke- good luck to all who fight against the urge to smoke & to those who are in the process of quitting -it's worth every breath you can take without hacking.

column2: CindySmokefree, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I stopped smoking on the 8th day of Chantix.  I experienced nausea and irritability. I found that I could avoid the nausea by taking the pill in the middle of a meal (insulating my stomach from the pill).  I have had some weird dreams intermittently and tend to be impatient and irritable.  The cravings have mostly gone.  I remind myself of the health and financial benefits of not smoking when I want one.  The Doctor said I should get to a point when I would have no desire to smoke--since I still had some desire at the end of 90 days of Chantix, I asked for a refill.  My insurance did not cover Chantix beyond 90 days.  I've tried to quit several times in the past without success.  Even with the side effects, I found this to be the easiest and most successful method.  I am also taking Prozac and noticed that I am a little more down than normal with Chantix, but I have begun feeling better as the nicotine leaves my system.  I haven't drunk any alcohol because of the stories I've heard about Chantix and alcohol.  I slipped up twice after my stop date.  I stopped smoking almost 4 months ago and have been totally smokefree for almost 2 months.  Smoking was an integral part of everything I did, so the hardest part for me is to separate the smoking habit from all of my life activities.  I'm glad Chantix is working for me and it's unfortunate that it doesn't work for everyone.  Good luck!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
kschiller11, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I USED to smoke 1-2 packs a day! UGH I can't belive I ever did that it is so discusting!! for 30 years. I quit on 2/1/07. I have had no desire to ever smoke again even under stress. I feel GREAT thanks Chantex. I will never smoke again.

column2: Shabby27, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug is like magic. I decided to quit smoking on a whim. My insurance covered most of it so I decided, what do I have to lose? I'm almost 29 and I've been smoking since I was 14. A pack a day. I'm on my 5th day without a cigarette, before Chantix I couldn't even make it 1 hour without a cigarette. My g/f continues to smoke and it doesn't even bother me. There are still cravings, but they are light and they pass. I eat a little before taking because of nausea and I did have the jitters the first day quitting. Thank you Chantix developers, you deserve the nobel prize. This is definitley a break through.

column2: ambiguity, 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: I want to quit and I am considering taking CHANTIX but I have many questions first.I already suffer from chronic constipation and take MIRALAX every other day to stay regular. I also take a high daily dose of ELAVIL [antidepressant] I am concerned about drug interaction.I also have cancer [in remission 18 months]and wonder if I should take this medication.My PRIMARY says I can take it and can just stop if I can't handle the side effects.Any advice would be helpful.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is my miracle drug. As of 1/6/08 it's been 6 weeks since I quit. The only side effect that I've experienced is taking it on an empty stomach made me alittle sick. Taking the pills with a glass of milk stopped the sickness. This has been the easiest thing I've ever done. Now if I could only lose the 15lbs that I've gained that easy.

column2: temptaker1@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have tried to quit smoking so many times with no success until I used Chantix.  It worked...it was so easy.  I have been smoke free for a year now

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Christmas06 dr. told me I had a rare precancer in throat that smoke/alcohol worsenned the existance. dr. said i could keep it away without surgery or drugs by stopping. HELLO WAKE UP CALL SMOKING WILL KILL ME IF I CANT QUIT. a friend told me about this new drug(the dr knew nothing about chantix).i was ready 2 try again chantix made it simple it really was.thanks for giving me a smoke free life. I SMOKED A PACK A DAY FOR 20YEARS SINCE 14 I'M NOW 34.

column2: mayfly, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been a smoker for 16 years and have never wanted to quit until recently.  I took the medicine for a short time and knew that I was done smoking for good.  It does make you feel nautious for about 20-30 minutes immediately after you take your pill but goes away.  I have noticed a 10 lb weight gain in the past month which worries me because I am a fitness instructor and know it is not because I am not exercising or watching what I eat.  I would add weight gain can be a typical side effect as with any medication.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on chantix now for 60 days and have been smoke free for 51 days. I had tried other methods to stop smoking before but nothing worked. I was a pack a day smoker for over 30 years and now I think cigarette smoke stinks..and as far as the side effects I have had very few unusual dreams and gas for the first 2 weeks.

column2: msloke52, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I really want to quit smoking because I have copd.I tried the chantix and had severe depression.Is this one of the side effects.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I smoked 1 pack(+) per day for ten years and was unable to quit. After taking Chantix and gradually dininishing the number of cigarettes I smoked (because I no longer had the urge-just the habit), at five weeks I had my last cigarette. I stopped taking Chantix in the middle of my seventh week. It has been two months since I have had a cigarette-and I have not had an urge to smoke since! I cannot say enough about this product. It saved my life.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I spent 8 days in the hospital with brain seizures that took the form of crippling headaches.  They cycled in 24 hour periods after 12 days on the medication.  I was finally transported to the hospital in an ambulance.  I was given every test to determine another cause for the headaches, but everything came up negative.  I was treated with pain medication until the drugs could clear my system.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had some minor side effects with Chantix, similar to those that I had when trying the patch, such as bad dreams, constipation, fatigue, but after the first few weeks, the symptoms have lessened. I still have the dreams, but they don't make me wake up as much. The worst symptom is the nausea that I get immediately after taking the pill. Eating crackers helps with that. There is something I've noticed recently that I think is related - when I go jogging, my sweat has a strong metallic odor. This has only started recently, so I think it must be related to the medication. This doesn't happen if I work out in a gym, so it must be related to the way I sweat when jogging. I've been absolutely smoke free for 40 days now with very little urges to quit. The side effects were worth it to be free of the constant mental desire for a smoke. This is the first time that its been easy for me to quit. Its been actually so easy that I feel like I got away with something!! I'm happy with my experience on Chantix and would recommend it to anyone. However, I will note that when my 12 weeks are up, I'm going to be happy to be off of it and get a decent nights sleep! I've been actively using the get-quit website and plan to continue using it until my year is up.

column2: precious722, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Me and my husband both have been smokers for over 30 years and smoked 1 to 2 packs a day.  We decided to do this together and it works.  After just a few days we were down to just half a pack a day.  Now we have quit totally and so glad.  Yes there are side effects like feeling like we have the stomach flu and some moodiness but that we can deal with.  I would rather have some side effects than keep smoking.  This is the ONLY THING THAT WORKS!!!!!!!!  I recommend it highly to anyone and everyone. My grandson told us now you get to see me grow up.  It brought tears to our eyes.  Our doctor gave us medication for the nausea which helps but there is no way I would give up on this medication.  I am also bipolar and have anxiety and major depression and doing fine even with all my other medications.  I hope others will give it a chance.  Just work with your doctor.  Adjustments can be made to your meds.  Its better to quit smoking than to stop this medication if at all possible.  Good Luck to you all.

column2: bcheryl8, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: Made me have strange dreams and made me depressed while I was on it.  Have been quit 6 months withf no slipups.  I am glad i took it and quit.

column2: smoker, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This med caused extreme anxiety-worse 3 weeks of my life!  lost my drives license after totalling my car while having an anxiety attack.  Would recommend NOT taking this-pursue other methods!!

column2: inadilema, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started smoking 10 years ago and have been smoke free for 7 days now, but worried about the next weeks to come.  I had bad dreams the first week and continue to have an upset stomach, which forces me to eat more than I usually do.  I find myself to be irritable and yelling at people when I'm not one to get upset easily.  I hope that I can continue to take this drug for a few more weeks, but may need to quit if the side affects get any worse.  I have a history of getting most side affects that come with drugs, so I avoid them when possible.  I still crave a smoke now and again, but nothing like the times when I quit 'cold turkey'.  Please be careful if you are generally sensitive to prescription drugs!  Every time I take a pill, I weigh the pros and cons and make a decision.  So far the benefits outweigh the side affects.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am very pleased that I am in the Habit of "no smoking" the smell in my home and on my critters is gone! I have COPD so I had no choice but to quit smoking. I was difficult at first but worth the money I saved, and my health is getting better. Thank You for Chantix the end result is worth the withdrawl

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor told me to quit smoking and wrote a prescription for this. It made me not want to smoke. In fact I didn't think about smoking, but in the meantime I was angry, aggressive, depressed, afraid and it made me feel extremly bad about myself. I stopped taking this medicine, and I'm still smoking.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication since 12/13. I had trouble quitting on my eighth day. I tried and the fits got to me. I tried again, and have been smoke free for two days with very very minor fits. The fits have not been strong enough for me to light up again. If you fail at quitting the first time, try again! I feel great! I have not had any huge impacting side effects such as suicidal thinking or depression. I have, however, experienced side effects such as unusual dreams, nausea just for a few minutes after I take Chantix, and I have gotten a few sores on my tongue. All these side effects I believe are worth becoming smoke free!

column2: Jo, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I was convinced nothing could work for me.  I am the poster child for this medication!

column2: ibeb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have been completely quit 2 days! after smoking over 30 yrs. Has anyone using chantix had dental work done? I have a dental appointment minor surgery and am worried about taking chantix. Anyone who is/has done dental work on chantix, please post!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used this medication for 3 weeks and I had feelings of depression and suicidal thoughts. My doctor said this is a very rare side effect. I would still recommend this to everyone because while I was on it I did slow down on my smoking.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This is the only thing that worked for me.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The side effects were diahreha, bad stomach cramps, I always took it with a full glass of water & w/a meal but I still got diahreha, gas,  bloating, cramps. Even with all the side effects I quit my 2 1/2 pack a day habit, so, I'm not complaining!!!!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I quit smoking after taking Chantix for one week, I was a pack a day smoker for 34 years.  It seemed easy!  After taking Chantix for almost 30 days, I feel that it was in conflict with the Lexapro that I have been taking for 3 years.  I immediately stopped taking the Chantix as my anxiety went skyhigh.  I have now been off the Chantix for almost 30 days, have not smoked for 54 days, it has been a struggle.  My anxiety is high (but getting better) so I want to smoke.  It is not as easy as it first appeared!  However, I am committed to staying quit and nothing worth while is easy, or so they say!

column2: gbvirden, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After only 3 weeks, I have no urge to smoke at all. I have quit the Chantix, but after 4 days began feeling "weird, dizziness and very tired. After 3 days of the dizzy spells my wife hauled me to the ER. CT, EKG, dopler on the carotid arteries, everything negative. My daughter insists its the effects of the Chantix, and it may be, as it is the only difference I have had going on. But I am smoke free and the ER DR says hoopefully it (Dizziness) will pass. To follow up with my Dr. after the Holidays

column2: geri, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I quit after 30 yrs. of smoking, I am on month 9 and am very satified, the urge is gone and I am glad.

column2: AngelBlue53, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The side effects are horrible. Joint and muscle pain as well as losing the sight in my right eye after taking Chantix for 5 months. My Dr. prescribed it for 6 months, that's too long!

column2: boftron, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had to take this drug twice. It is very effective and helps you quit smoking, but you must keep your will power going once you're off Chantix. The only reason I have started smoking again after taking Chantix was due to being drunk and around a crowd of smokers. I highly recommend this drug to anyone that is thinking of quiting.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I did not experience any side effects, that's good, but I also didn't stop smoking. I tried Chantix three times, for ninety days each, time after time, I failed. I was so hopeful this would work, I was quite excited about quitting, and thought this is it! I'm disappointed, and still smoking.

column2: 55-64 Male
column9: you have to try this .Ismoked 3 packs a day for 35 years and tried everything gum,patches  you name it this was the onlything that worked i have beed smoke free for over 5 months

column2: Nana_in_ia, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The drug has made me feel sick to my tummy and  Iam hard Vowel troubles and lots of pain from it

column2: stlsu, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I feel great after only 2 weeks on the medicine and 1 week smoke free.

column2: Ivefallen, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 54 year old malesmoked for 35+ yearslost count on the number of times I tried to quit, twice I stopped for 3 years.stopped smoking for a a year now due to ChantixIt works, it works, it works.Have read about the suicidal and agressive behaviour. I have had the agresssive behavious, however I do not think it is due to the Chantix as my three month prescription ran out 9 months ago and the agreessive behaviour still persists from time to time. My thoughts are that it is the nicotine withdrawl which in the past was probably one of the triggers that got me smoking again after I quit. Only that gland no longer is part of the addictive urge and I stay off the cigarettes. Additionally I have experienced a huge metabolic shift in my body regarding weight, sleep, cognitive thought etc and I honestly believe this will go on till my body finishes re-adjusting. It is better, but only by small degrees and I imagine I have one to two years to go. But it is still better than smoking as far I am concerned.

column2: donna, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: my husband has been on this drug for a whie now and it has definately helped him slow down, he is sick w. MDS a bone marrow failure disease, i think it is working and helping his dependance

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: JLG, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Marydidit, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
