column2: SPRAYLADY, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: IT'S A MIRACLE, I FEEL AS THO I HAVE NEVER HAD A CIGARETTE.

column2: ddrstlouis@msn.com, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i tried everything else but could not overcome my addiction to nicotine. i now have been 10 months nicotine free

column2: Ryan, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I smoked for 2 packs a day for 10 years. I took this medication for 2 weeks, stopped smoking and stopped the medication after 1 month and I have been smoke free, and medication free for a month and a half so far! I had no side effects, except for minor upset stomach for the first week and a half. If you want to quit smoking use this medication! It's amazing!

column2: Bill, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is the one!!

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medicine WORKS. I took it for 5 days and quit completely in 2. 3 months is the recommended period but why take meds if you don't need to? It makes smoking cigarettes pointless more or less. However, I have experienced nausea, headaches, drowsiness, and I "space out" and day dream since I quit. I think it's hard to determine if the lack of smoking or chantix is the cause. I suppose it's all worth it since it's been 6 weeks and I have zero desire to smoke.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: On the night of the 8th day of medication, I was rushed to the hospital with pancreatitis. After eliminating other possible causes, my doctor determined that Chantix was the cause. Days of severe pain, heavy pain meds, no food and hospitalization were not exactly the things I wanted to do to quit smoking.  I suppose I quit by default since I was on dilaudid then morphine for more than a week.

column2: crawdaddy, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I quit smoking after two weeks of taking it, and stopped taking it after the month was up. I did not need to get a refill. The two problems I had while taking Chantix were slight nausea and EXTREMELY graphic dreams. They were not nightmares, just incredibly realistic and vivid.Now that I have stopped taking it, I seem to have a lot of trouble sleeping. No suicidal thoughts or any thing like that.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: Never thought I'd stop, didn't think I would with this either.  Did though after about 10 days. Remarkable. Don't like the stomach upset - small price to pay though.

column2: 25-34 on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: My wife and I would recommend Chantix more than anything in this world.  I've tried those alternate ways like the "quit nicotine by taking nicotine" patch and gum and because you are still taking the nicotine you have to put 100% willpower into quitting and then the withdrawals were terribly nerve wrenching.  My wife and I both smoked.... I for 20+ years and she for 15 and we both quit using Chantix. The drug totally eases the withdrawls to the point you lose track of the time and smoking sensations and realize you haven't had a cigarette in a much longer time than you are used to going without a cigarette. After smoking 1 1/2 packs a day (sometimes 2) I was down to less than 10 cigarettes in just over a week without even trying yes that is right I said "without even trying"...I just didn't think to have that next cigarette like I would have before. That is what Chantix does....it blocks the nicotine from getting to those pleasure centers in the brain and therefore keeps the withdrawls at bay. The final kick requires some willpower but only 10% compared to 90% with the patch and gum. Side effects: Personally I had a couple very vivid dreams but no nightmares and my wife experienced slight nausea for a couple days on the 1/2 mg to 1 mg dose change and vivid dreams as well but not continuously. It was 3 weeks later and we both quit for good. We continued taking the Chantix for a week after but had no problems after having stopped taking the Chantix. No Chantix withdrawls as some falsified blogs have stated would happen. You will not feel a need to continue taking Chantix after quitting smoking or taking Chantix. Anything you read or hear about "Chantix withdrawls" are totally false. The price of the drug is well worth the savings you will see after quitting buying cigarettes as well!! Between my wife and I we now save $350-$400 month not smoking....in 2 weeks we payed for our prescriptions!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It was completely effective in helping me to quit smoking, it did make me nauseaous once i was up to whole pills at once, and I was extremely irritable three weeks into it, I'm not sure to the other mood effects at this point or its just that i'm not smoking anymore!! :)

column2: Smilenr0, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Smoked 14 years a pack a day. picked a quitting day and was my bday and I haven't picked up a cig. since that day. I recommend these medicine to anyone that woudl like to stop smoking and nothing else out there is helping!!!!! =)

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've smoked 3-4pks for 40+yrs & this is the only thing that took the desire away completely! When I even smell the smoke, it makes me turn my nose.  I would recommend it for those who REALLY want to quit & haven't been able to. I've done patches & couldn't get off the lst step..Zyban..nothing..gum...nothing...natural...n othing... Within 1stwk my desire decreased greatly. I did the 3mo program & by end of 2mos.. I was not taking the Rx twice a day b/c it was working so well.  If I ever get the urge or something upsets me, I just chew on toohpicks. CONS: I did have the terrible nightmares but that lasted a short time.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After numerous attempts I finally stopped smoking. Craving were virtualy nonexistant. I never had the upset stomach that was the most common side effect. In fact I don, remember having any side effects. What a wonderful drug!

column2: smokefree, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Pack and a half a day for over 25 years. I have been on this drug for a little over a month and have had 3 cigarettes since my quit date. I have not had any reactions that some of the other reviews speak of.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Was put on Chantix right after hysterectomy. I have been a 1 pack a day smoker for over 24 years. Been on it now for 2 weeks. Havent quit completely but today is my stop smoking day. I have cut back to 2 cigarettes a day! This is amazing. Have had problems sleeping the last week. And other problems that could be linked to this RX or my surgery. I will not give it up. Worth all of the side effects so far just to see my grandbabies grow up.My father died of lung cancer. He died a horrible and painful death. I dont want my grandkids to have to go thru that and this RX is helping me prevent that.

column2: bac1851, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Smoked for 43 yrs. now down to 6/7 a day, been on meds for about 7 weeks, my doctor says I'm doing great.  Have to change your behavior and old habits, so I'm trying.  But...some bad side affects.  Along with the vivid dreams, bloating, anxiety I had extreme swelling of my feet and legs to the point I couldn't even walk with out assistance.  the swelling didn't start till last week.  My doctor and pharmacist both agree it was the chantix.  Caused a rise in my bp and joint pain.  It works but can have some serious side affects.   Be careful and good luck.

column2: Petite, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Cut down on smoking (18 Yrs) from 1 pack a day to 1 pack a week.  Having difficulty with sleeping.  Not at all then can't get up no matter how hard I try.  Making me depressed. Cut back to 1 pill in morning.  Make me fell strange and make my mouth dry.

column2: monk7, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I beg anyone considering this drug to look up a discussion board tying chantix with depression or anxiety--dozens of people who have had their mental health seriously compromised (perhaps permanently) due to chantix--i really don't know if i will ever recover from the severe panic attacks and suicidal depression

column2: TNgal, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is a miracle drug for smokers! I had smoked for 9 years, and this drug made it very easy to quit. I had two intense surgeries, could not quit smoking through the first one, chantix helped with the second. I have now been on it almost two months. I am still nauseous, sometimes worse than others, and doesn't matter how much I eat. My doc prescribed nausea med which helps. Vivid dreams I can live with. Been bloated. Very anxious at times. Walking seems to help dramatically with these side effects. The side effects are bad, but not near as bad as what smoking does. I just remind myself of the life long benefits vs. the short term bad side effects.

column2: jkdkjkkk,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The product works.  I have not had upset stomach, vivid dreams, or upset stomach.  I am smoke free for about 10 weeks and have only two to go.  The only side effect I have had is constipation and 5 pound weight gain and some bloated feeling.  My doctor cut the dosage in half so I take one half the pill in the morning and one half at night and that has cut the side effect enormously.  The side effects for me are tolerable to quit smoking and I would recommend this product to everyone and have.

column2: dhryan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Chantix, the white knight of smoking cessation, has the potential of being extremely dangerous, especially for those with pre-existing mental health conditions.  I am bipolar--i stopped taking chantix because i found the nightmares intolerable and found it completely ineffective.  Two days after quiting, i became suicidally depressed and suffered excruciating panic attacks.  Welcome to the side effects (not advertised) of chantix.

column2: ellie16935, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: been nauseaous since i been on it and still smoke. was hoping for a miracle. under a lot of stress. will keep trying

column2: tryingtoquit, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The medication does eliminate the desire to smoke (tastes like nothing)--however the side effects were unacceptable. 5 straight days of a headache that no pain reliever could touch.  Took 48 hours of not taking the medication for the headache to diminish.  This started at end 'end of week 4', so don't assume you are OK if it takes a while for side effects.  No way could I take this medication for longer than 3 weeks.

column2: cam12298, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Its been a month and it seems to be working,,,as far as the side effect of nausea,,,theres no comparison to the nausea from chemo treatments. I just fear that the urge will come back after I stop the pills.Also Im not thrilled that my insurance did not cover this medication that could prevent so many other illnesses.Low income people will not have access to this drug and that is biased.

column2: red hen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: One of the worst experiences of my life. After 2 weeks on chantix I was sleeping 18 hrs a day, slurred speach, chest pain, confusion,irrational thinking, unsteady gait, dissorentation, extremely emotional,major depression,  I became suicidal to the point of being hospitalized for 3 days in the phyc. ward. Horrifying experience to be admitted, strip searched, not completely understanding what has happened. How do I live with the memory of my children seeing me there and in that condition? completely out of control. embarrassed and ashamed and scared. Difficult symptoms continued for 2 weeks after stopping the medication, anxiety, slurred speach, dizzy, afraid to leave the house for fear of becoming like that away from home where I could not get help. I know this works very well for some people w/ little or no side effects, but please, if you decide to use this product, ask your family/friends to watch you carefully, and help you to contact your dr. if they feel your behavior has changed enough to worry them. You may not always be thinking clearly enough to seek help youself. I paid dearly, much much more than my $30 copay, to quit smoking for 10 days.... Be carefull.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have smoked for 25 years have been smoke free 2 months now. Not sleeping was the worst side effect.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I was a 3 carton a week smoker of 50 years, everything about me smelled horrible, including my vehicle. My wife couldn't stand to ride in it ot the the smell of me.I used Chantix for 1 week and haven't smoked in 4 months. I have only had a couple bad dreams, no nausea or anything else. and the dreams were not that bad. If I feel bored, instead of eating I go for a walk.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It works great for quitting smoking but the side effects are bad.  I have bad dreams can't sleep and have been depressed.  I am going to stop taking the medication.  Hopefully I will not start smoking again.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: while it is easy to use and it does work, it makes you very nauseaus for a few hours after you take it for the first couple weeks.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug works!! I quit after taking it for one week. I have no urge to smoke. I do have some bad side effects: nausea, nightmares(very scary), and mood swings. I am going to stop taking the drug because of these, but I am confident I will not smoke again. I tried Zyban in the past and Chantix worked much better for me.Great drug if you really want to quit!

column2: 40yrsmoker, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this is working for me like no other treatment i've tried. side effects are minimal, dreams are great.tho i do get a little angry at times, nothing i can't handle.

column2: teri h, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'd been a 2-pack-a-day smoker for over 30 years.  I'd tried the patch, gum & hypnotism without success.  When I tried to stop smoking, I became a fire breathing dragon & an employer can't afford a bad temper.  It isn't fair to employees, not to mention my family.About the dreams - I had the best dreams that I'd had in about 25 years.  I actually woke up giggling-yes, giggling!  THe vivid dreams lasted only about three weeks and have not returned.  Quitting was painless.  In fact, because you keep smoking while taking Chantix, you don't notice the medication at all.  One AM I was doing the braille walk towards the patio with cigarette and coffee in hand.  I stopped & said to myself "you haven't had a morning buzz in two weeks.  Try something different."  So, I put the cigarette down and played a game of solitaire on my computer.  I haven't smoked for over three months now.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: smoked for 25 years, didn't think I'd ever be able to quit.  This drug works!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking the pills and actually quit smoking before my quit date.  Which i think is excellent after smoking for 19 years.  The only side effect i experienced was my dreams were a little more strange than normal.

column2: EnoughisEnough, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I think that this drug is a miricle!!!! I have smoked for 16 years and quit in a week. You really have to want to quit. And I really did. I was sick and tired of not being able to breathe, feeling sick all the time, depressed, and smelling like an ashtray. I had a couple of headaches when I was on the medication, but that was it. Overall, I don't smoke anymore and I'm very grateful that I quit. Especially, with all the health risks from smoking. I want to be here when my kids graduate from high school. The only one in control of your body is you! So if you really want to quit, you will, with or without this medication. Chantix helps make quitting a little easier. Good luck.

column2: JennyV22, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: If you truly want to quit, this drug will help you do it.  I'd tried many times to quit but finally did w/this.  Vivid dreams were my worst side effect - my dr gave me lorazepam which helped immensely.  Took Chantix for about 45 days and didn't need it any more.  I was over nicotine withdrawal and it was simply a matter of mind over matter.  Knew I didn't want to smoke anymore and didn't want to have weird dreams or take any more rx than necessary.  If you're ready to quit...this may be the drug for you -- but you truly have to want to quit.  The initial cost of buying a months worth (~$130) is actually less than smoking cost me - and I'm healthier for it.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Wife and I got on it together about 2-3 weeks ago.  Cravings for cigarettes were totally gone in a few days.  Unfortunately, both had severe mood swings, severe depression, even occasional suicidal thoughts for me and uncontrollable bouts of crying sometimes half the night for no reason.  Argued with her more in 3 weeks than in the entire rest of our marriage.  Drug works great but the side effects we had are NOT worth it.  Not going back to smoking, will stay off cigarettes but will NOT take this drug one more day.  Would only recommend this drug if very closely supervised by a doctor for psychological side effects not listed on the information pack.  Don't know if anyone else has experienced this but it's scary.  Total mood change in us both.

column2: CBOLIN26, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I HAVE SMOKED SINCE I WAS 15 AND NEVER THOUGHT I WOULD BE ABLE TO QUIT. I HAD TRIED EVERYTHING BUT THIS REALLY WORKS. THE CRAVINGS HAVE ALMOST GONE NOW AND I HAVE ONLY BEEN ON CHANTIX FOR A MONTH NOW.  THE ONLY NEGATIVE THING I HAVE TO SAY ABOUT IT IS THE MOODS SWINGS I AM HAVING WITH CHANTIX.

column2: wgrant, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Chantix for 30 days and it has made me not want to smoke.  My problem is that it makes me extremely sick to my stomach.  I take it with food and drink a lot of water but it continues to make me sick.  Does anyone have any suggestions to help with the nausea????  I have trouble sleeping, but I can deal with that.thanks

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have smoked since I was 16, and did 23 years in the Navy, smoking heavily. I have tried hundred of times to quit and have always failed. I am 49 and this is simply amazing. I walk into a smoke filled roomand I'm not even affected. It does have slight side effects. Weird dreams, restless nights, but I'll take that anyday. I'm only into my first week, the rest will come later!

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This works.(period)

column2: smokefree and happy, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have tried to quit chewing and then smoking for years (25 to 30), with the gum, patch or lozengers but you never get off the nicotine.  If you are ready to quit chantix will get you there.  The only side effects that I experinced were felt a lttle sick to my stomach for and about 30 minute after talking the pill, a little restless sleep but not every night and it dulled my tatse.  But that's nothing compare to getting the tobacco monkey off my back.........I highly recommend this,

column2: JD, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: AMAZING! Before I started this medication, if someone would ask me when I was going to stop smoking, I would have said "when i am six feet under". This product was great and I would recommend it to anyone. yes some side effects like weird dreams..but I would rather have weird dreams for a little while than lung cancer!! My cravings are managable, I have cut down from 2 packs a day to 4 cigs a day and I have not even reached my "quit date" yet!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had no withdrawl.  I didn't need a cigarette at. All i had to do was tell myself no when I thought I needed one or when I was used to having one.

column2: stillsmokefreeanyway, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The extreme side effects made it necessary to stop taking the meds. I slept fine, but it was completely non-refreshing. The gastrointestinal upset was severe. The anxiety and overall "jittery" feeling was what ultimately did me in. I felt as if I was about to climb out of my own skin and was extremely irritable. Someone told me that what happens on this drug is that it takes away the "pleasure" of smoking, but the problem is that it takes away the pleasure of EVERYTHING! Someone said this is being tested for use in persons that are addicted to other drugs????? My husband and I started this medicine at the same time and he almost suffered a relapse from recovery due to the side effects.

column2: Lori, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I tried to quit smoking 3 times, this is the easiest, most successful experience using Chantix. Highly recommend this approach.
Lots of side effects not listed

column2: Kikki, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I could not take chantix in the evening as it caused nightmares during my sleep.

column2: jerry g, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I smoked for 48 years and was able to quit in less than two months. This product works.

column2: stevee, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Causes mild hearing loss.  Unknown if this is temporary or permanent.  User has 95 dB hearing loss (avg. 65 dB).  Uses hearing aid as last resort.  Notices loss of sound range. Need more datapoint to eliminate other variables (old hearing aids, aging)

column2: Kim, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 43 yr old female recently diagnoised with COPD.  This is a great product!

column2: trying to quit, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking the medication as prescribed and by the fourth day into it, I found myself depressed and crying all of the time, similar to when I took Welbutrin for the same reason-to quit smoking. I alreay suffer from depression as it is and after the way the Chantix was making me feel inside, I quit taking the med. It is in the plan to discuss this with personal MD soon.  Good luck and if anyone else experienced similar feelings, please post something. thank you for listening and for being brave enough to post. tryingtoquit

column2: refbum, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Over 25 years of smoking a pack a day.  If only I could stop or cut down.  Somedays I'd light a cigarette and have no idea why I lit it.  I was overweight and having trouble breathing yet I lit a cigarette.  I started a few other methods and they did not work.I started taking Chantix and after about 1 week, I noticed I wasn't even reaching for my cigarettes as much.  I was now smoking less than half a pack a day.  I did not set my date to quit at 10 days.  At first, I fooled myself into thinking "Man, I can only smoke a few a day, this is GREAT".  I felt my breathing getting better and suddenly justified that I could just smoke a few taking this medication and that would be ok.  I went to my doctors office on the next visit and saw a man carrying a portable oxygen tank.  My few cigarettes a day weren't worth it.  After about day 20, I'd say, I was greatly relieved that I could go all day long without even ONE cigartte, then day two, then three.  25 years of smoking and the last 5 years regretting every single second I lit one up.  All that gone and I am breathing and feeling much better.  My insurance didn't reimburse me one penny for the three month treatment, (so check your insurance) but that was the BEST money well spent I have ever did.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Chantix worked very well to help me quit smoking. I took the medication as directed for 2-3 months and have been 100% nicotine free since March 2007.  It did not at all minimize my cravings but it did make cigarettes taste like "air" and not enjoyable.  Please try it - any short term discomfort you may have to go through is so much better than smoking!!!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took Chantix for 6 weeks. I did have headaches,muscle aches, weird dreams and constipation but did not want to smoke at all. I would suggest not drinking alcohol with it.

column2: beanwagon, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The side effects I have experienced are well worth quitting smoking. The nausea gets pretty intense for me, but only if I don't eat before the medicine. I have had lots of vivid dreams, but I think that's cool. I think Chantix is great!

column2: Dr. W.H. Love, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug does give me a feeling of "being high". But it beats the heck out of smoking yourself to death. I do worry some may become addicted to this "high" whether it be physical or psychological. I would not recommend this drug to mentally fragil individuals.

column2: Madtaxman, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had smoked 2 packs a day for 40 years and no other treatment helped. This was like magic. I have been off cigarettes for 6 months or so and have had about three cravings. I could not have been happier. The only side effect I had was some very weird dreams the first week but they stopped. I can even be around smokers now without it making me want a smoke. It is like a pixie comes to visit and sprinkle her pixie dust on me while I sleep. I haven't felt better in years. Also, no gain in weight. I don't understand but I guess that pixie just keeps coming around. Now, if I could just start exercising!

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month

column9: So far so good! Stopped smoking after 8 days on the pill. A little nausea but that was gone after 4 days. Feel great now and do not have much urge to smoke. This drug did it-I could never have done it on my own.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am into week 8 of taking Chantix and have only smoked two cigarettes since the first week (in which you're allowed to smoke). When I smoked those cigarettes, I got absolutely no satisfaction from it and they tasted awful! I've tried many times and several methods to quit and while Chantix is no magic bullet, this has been the easiest method for me. I've experienced no side effects at all and within 2 -3 weeks began to notice that my sense of smell was returning and I could breathe easier. I've started including short bursts of jogging into my daily walking routine, which I could never do before without gasping for breath. I really feel that by the time I reach the end of my 12 weeks, I'll be able to continue being a non-smoker without the need for additional medication. My neighbors (who have both been smoke-free for 6 months now) told me about it and now I'm a firm believer that if you really want to quit, this medication can help you be successful.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I haven't smoked in 52 days, but there is no way I can continue this medication.  Besides the stomach issues, I have wild mood swings and am lashing out at people for minor things.  I am also exhausted all the time.  I read a recent newspaper article that indicated that Chantix could cause or intensify depression and/or anxiety; so, I can only hope that in a few days my energy level rebounds and I am not so crabby.  Drinking alcohol and taking Chantix does not mix well.  My alcohol tolerance has been exteremely low while on Chantix.  But, after all is said and done, I was able to quit my 16 year habit using this medication alone.  I also feel that the folks that have continued to smoke really don't want to quit that bad.  You must WANT it and WANT it BADLY...it is hell to give up a habit that is so ingrained in your personality.  Sure there are times that I want to smoke...but I WANT to be a non-smoker.  That's why the pills worked for me and not for my husband.  I would recommend them to others as long as the person was aware of the side-effects.

column2: pennybenofsky@yahoo.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Finally, a product that is really effective.  I am a 61 y/o woman who smoked one to one and a half pks a day for 46 years.  I tried every product out there, multiple times w/o success.  Chantix works in the addiction center of the brain which in turns stops the craving for tobacco. So, it is not that I never had the willpower to quit before and failed ---- it was that other methods did not treat the addictive power of nicotine.  They merely traded the method delivery of nicotine into my body when using patches or gums, etc.  I thank my doctor and the makers of Chantix for every smoke free day I have. column2: tobee44, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: while this drug helps you quit smoking, which is so very vital to your health, the withdrawal of the drug feels as though you may die from it.bone aches, swollen joints, so tired that you cannot fuction on a daily basis. it also changes your taste buds. fresh clean water tastes like soured grapefruit juice. coffee taste burnt. both my husband and i had different but just as dramtic side effects which we are still going through. he stopped the drug on july 3 2007 and is still having problems. i stopped less that two weeks ago and have been so ill i cannot funtion.interesting fact....this drug works at it's own pace. with my husband it kicked in within two weeks and with me...2 months. but you have to hang in there. the most success is when you continue the drug for 3 months after you have stopped the smoking...which is what i did.i called the drug company to tell them all the side effects... they tell me this will all pass. well.... i hope so.now......the best and greatest of news.... provided i live through the withdrawal of this drug..........IT WORKS. i smoked 3 packs for 41 one years....NOTHING WORKED FOR ME. this did.
